author: Pamela Silvestri
title: Egg prices keep soaring; try these trustworthy egg substitutes for cooking and baking
text:
Blame it on the bird flu or human politics. Any way you slice it, the incredible, edible egg is just so incredibly expensive. But there is a practical solution to this eggs-istential situation: Donâ€™t use them.
Whatâ€™s the point of using eggs, anyway? By themselves, theyâ€™re a good source of protein. In baked goods, they provide necessary chemistry for binding ingredients and achieving palatable outcomes. Egg whites provide â€œliftâ€ to dry ingredients, while yolks add both creaminess and body to a recipe.
READ MORE: Egg prices are soaring, and Oregonâ€™s among the states hardest hit. Hereâ€™s why
Commercially produced egg replacers can work in lieu of real eggs. However, I have found some products to be unpleasant looking and believe that homemade substitutions are more natural and healthy.
A search through YouTube will turn up oodles of insights into egg-free solutions. Here are three trustworthy ones for items like cookies, pancakes, loaf cakes, cupcakes and muffins. Some tinkering with ratios might be needed with the addition of baking powder to very wet batters for the extra â€œpoofâ€ with the final product.
Also check out the accompanying video with professional chef and Bigger Bolder Baking show host Gemma Stafford â€” Biggerbolderbaking.com. The demonstration she illustrates with a pound cake recipe uses a variety of egg stand-ins like silken tofu, banana, yogurt, buttermilk, sweetened condensed milk and flax egg. She even breaks down exact measurements on a handy chart via this link â€” Bit.ly/EggSubstitutes.
Here are a few other easy swaps for eggs.
1. Apple or pear sauce
Itâ€™s easy to make from scratch, but the unsweetened, store-bought version is just as ideal. Pears are delicious but have a graininess that may or may not be desirable. In general, for every egg you would have used in a recipe, substitute 1/4 cup applesauce. Optionally, add 1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon of baking powder per egg to give more â€œliftâ€ with the additional moisture.
2. Yogurt, sour cream and ricotta cheese
Use full-fat dairy products as an egg substitute at a ratio of 1/4 cup per egg. This is particularly great (and forgiving) in pancake recipes.
3. Cornstarch and water
For every egg, stir 1 tablespoon of cornstarch with 3 tablespoons of warm water. Mix until the cornstarch fully dissolves.
â€” Pamela Silvestri is Advance/SILive.com food editor. She can be reached at silvestri@siadvance.com.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->financial and economic news

author: @FWMirror
title: Musical memories that hit all the right notes | Whaleâ€™s Tales | Federal Way Mirror
text: By about 9:30 p.m. that November evening in 1967, the storm that had earlier lashed the Puget Sound region with howling winds and driving rain had calmed to a whisper. I had just climbed into bed when faintly through the open window of the room, I shared with my three brothers the chorus of a song that floated in from a radio perched on a neighborâ€™s sill. â€œIn the jungle, the quiet jungle, the lion sleeps tonight â€¦ Wee heeheehee weeoh aweem awayâ€¦â€ Even then, it seemed to me a sacred moment, and it lives in me today. Indeed, whenever I hear The Tokensâ€™ recording of that song, my head is once more at rest on a pillow in that small room, lit only by a sliver of light that spills in from the living room, where my mother sits and thumbs the latest copy of Better Homes and Gardens. In its train, that moment remembered carries exactly how the 5-year-old boy I was once had felt in the days when J.P. Patches, Brakeman Bill and Wunda Wunda were part of my world. Other tunes have had this lasting effect on me. Now approaching 62, I am more and more impressed by musicâ€™s power to summon memories, joyful and tragic, sacred and profane. Here are other songs Iâ€™ve heard over the years that have had this effect on me. Whenever I hear Mungo Jerryâ€™s washboard launch into â€œIn the Summertime,â€ it is 1969, and I am with my family at Lake Surprise. I am busy with my little bucket and shovel, secure in the knowledge that bottles of Hires Root Beer are chilling in a nearby cooler. Or I am threading my way past the sun worshippers star-scattered on the sand all to the old hall, where dust motes hang over the pinball machines and over the wooden floor worn smooth by generations of dancers. It is a happy song, and I cannot help but smile. Don McLeanâ€™s â€œVincent,â€ which was on the radio in the early 1970s, evokes a different set of remembrances â€” that of a version of Seattle that exists today only in my mind. Of long-vanished fish bars along the waterfront, and Ye Olde Curiosity Shop, and the Museum of History and Industry when the lower parking lot opened onto the damp trail of the University of Washingtonâ€™s Arboretum, the Frye Art Museum. The opening lines of T.S. Eliotâ€™s â€œFour Quartets,â€ while not sung, are certainly songlike, and they speak of regret: â€œFootfalls echo in the memory/Down the passage which we did not take/Towards the door we never opened /Into the rose-garden./My words echo Thus, in your mind/But to what purpose/ Disturbing the dust on a bowl of rose-leaves /I do not knowâ€¦â€ I suspect these melodies and lines and many more remembered have made me the time-haunted man that I am today. I hope you will share with me some of your own memories. Robert Whale can be reached at robert.whale@soundpublishing.com.

author: MENAFN
title: Zelensky On International Day For Women's Rights: Everything You Do For Ukraine Inspires The World | MENAFN.COM
text:
( MENAFN - UkrinForm) On International Women's Day, President Volodymyr Zelensky thanked Ukrainian women for everything they do for the country.
â€œUkrainian women treat, educate, volunteer, rescue, and bravely defend their families and country. They are professional, selfless, determined, and possess great inner strength. Our women love, raise, protect, and care. Everything they do for Ukraine inspires the entire world. I thank them for everything. I thank them for multiplying our common strength,â€ the President said in a post on social media platform X .
As reported, the International Day for Women's Rights and International Peace is celebrated on March 8.
Photo: President's Office

text:

Restaurant â€žPer Baccoâ€œ in Fulda schlieÃŸt - Leerstand in der FriedrichstraÃŸe
Noch vor rund einem Jahr hatte die Familie Filippelli groÃŸe PlÃ¤ne und angekÃ¼ndigt, die Immobilie des ehemaligen â€žLieblingsâ€œ zu Ã¼bernehmen. Ãœber drei Stockwerke wollte die Familie italienisches Flair versprÃ¼hen und kulinarische GenÃ¼sse anbieten.
â€žFÃ¼r das ehemalige â€šLieblingsâ€˜ suchen wir einen Nachmieterâ€œ, erklÃ¤rt der Gastronom. Klar ist: â€žWir werden in Fulda keine Gastronomie mehr betreiben.â€œ GerÃ¼chte, dass aus den PlÃ¤nen der Familie Filippelli nichts wird, gab es bereits im November vergangenen Jahres. Damals hatte Gastronom Ernesto Filippelli diese GerÃ¼chte noch abgestritten und erklÃ¤rt, dass eine ErÃ¶ffnung im April oder Mai angedacht sei. Jetzt ist die Zukunft dieser Immobilie also erneut ungewiss.
â€žEs war ein groÃŸes Projekt, das jetzt nicht umgesetzt wirdâ€œ, sagt Andreas Jahn, Kreisvorsitzender des Hotel- und GaststÃ¤ttenverbands Dehoga, doch es ist nicht nur das: â€žMan muss sehen, dass ein bestehender Gastronom wegfÃ¤llt. Es ist einfach schade, dass ein weiterer Betrieb verloren geht.â€œ
Dehoga-Vorsitzender glaubt nicht an schnelle Nachfolge in der FriedrichstraÃŸe
Dass schnell ein Nachmieter da ist, der die Immobilie Ã¼bernimmt, hÃ¤lt er fÃ¼r unwahrscheinlich. â€žDafÃ¼r stehen zu viele Objekte in der Region leer.â€œ Gerade jemanden zu finden, der die â€žLieblingsâ€œ-Immobilie Ã¼bernimmt, sei schwierig, da es ein Ã¤hnliches Projekt in der Stadt bisher noch nicht gegeben hat. â€žDie PlÃ¤ne waren mutig und cool, aber auch ambitioniertâ€œ, sagt Jahn.
â€žDer Standort in der FriedrichstraÃŸe liegt gut, wenn man zum Beispiel an die Domplatzkonzerte in Fulda denkt. Die Umgebung kÃ¶nnte ein Anreiz fÃ¼r jemanden sein, etwas Neues zu machenâ€œ, sagt Jahn und nennt als Beispiel das tschechische Restaurant Tondas, das vor wenigen Monaten in der MittelstraÃŸe seine Pforten geÃ¶ffnet hat. Ein Problem kÃ¶nnte die aktuelle wirtschaftliche Lage darstellen. â€žDeutschland steckt in einer Rezessionâ€œ, erinnert er. â€žVielleicht springt jemand auf den Zug auf. Deutsche KÃ¼che wÃ¤re wÃ¼nschenswert.â€œ

title: La Universidad Nebrija acoge el Campeonato Nacional de RobÃ³tica
text:
La Universidad Nebrija con la colaboraciÃ³n con la
CÃ¡tedra Global Nebrija-Santander en RecuperaciÃ³n de EnergÃ­a en el Transporte de Superficie y el Grupo de InvestigaciÃ³n Green promocionan el primer evento nacional de robÃ³tica tras la pandemia.
Tras el forzoso parÃ³n que ha limitado este tipo de actividades vuelve con fuerza un campeonato que dinamiza la colaboraciÃ³n entre personas y la innovaciÃ³n en campos ligados a la automÃ¡tica, el software, la sensÃ³rica y la dinÃ¡mica.
En esta primera ediciÃ³n pospandemia se abordarÃ¡n las modalidades de MINI-SUMO y VELOCISTA y se repartirÃ¡n interesantes premios.
El campeonato, que tendrÃ¡ lugar el dÃ­a 18 de mayo en el Campus de Madrid-Princesa de la Universidad de Nebrija, contarÃ¡ con la participaciÃ³n, fuera de programa, de campeones de ediciones anteriores que hablarÃ¡n sobre los retos superados, las tÃ©cnicas empleadas y las tendencias internacionales en estos campos.
Alto nivel de competiciÃ³n
RaÃºl Lapeira, organizador del Campeonato Nacional de RobÃ³tica, asegura: â€œTenemos mucha ilusiÃ³n en retomar la liga nacional de robÃ³tica, aunque en esta ediciÃ³n, por las especiales circunstancias, lo limitaremos a un Ãºnico campeonato y dos modalidades. Esperamos poder recuperar, en breve, la ilusiÃ³n y el alto nivel de competiciÃ³n y nÃºmero de participantes que ha caracterizado a la robÃ³tica en EspaÃ±aâ€.
â€œEste campeonato encaja perfectamente con las titulaciones que Nebrija ya tiene y las que estÃ¡ impulsando y esperamos que sea fuente de inspiraciÃ³n y de referencia para aquellos estudiantes que vayan a optar por unos estudios con alto contenido tecnolÃ³gico y un gran futuro profesionalâ€, seÃ±ala Juan Carlos Arroyo, director de la
PolitÃ©cnica Nebrija.
Javier Aranceta, director de la
CÃ¡tedra Global Nebrija-Santander en RecuperaciÃ³n de EnergÃ­a en el Transporte de Superficie, afirma que desde la CÃ¡tedra â€œllevamos aÃ±os impulsando la introducciÃ³n de los jÃ³venes en Ã¡reas tecnolÃ³gicas y en entornos de investigaciÃ³n colaborativa ligados al transporte. Los conocimientos, la colaboraciÃ³n y la multidisciplinariedad necesarias en esta competiciÃ³n estÃ¡n perfectamente alineados con este espÃ­ritu y esperamos que este evento contribuya de manera decisiva a retomar entre los jÃ³venes la ilusiÃ³n por abordar estas disciplinasâ€.
Por su parte, Francisco Badea, director del Grupo de InvestigaciÃ³n GREEN, aÃ±ade: â€œLa optimizaciÃ³n de por ejemplo los costes y los pesos es una constante en el entorno industrial. Desde el grupo Green llevamos aÃ±os orientando nuestra actividad hacia la consecuciÃ³n de altos estÃ¡ndares de automatizaciÃ³n en el automÃ³vil con una sensÃ³rica y tratamiento de datos a un coste tal que permita la universalizaciÃ³n de estas soluciones. Este campeonato incide, por las estrictas limitaciones a las que estÃ¡n sometidas los prototipos participantes, directamente con nuestros objetivos y es un placer apoyar este esfuerzo de los jÃ³venes estudiantes.

author: CNA
title: Apple launches 'age assurance' tech as US states mull social media laws - CNA
text:
Apple on Thursday said it will introduce a way for parents to share the age of a child with app developers without revealing sensitive information such as birthdays or government identification numbers.
The move comes as a number of U.S. state and federal lawmakers consider age-verification laws for social media and other apps.
States, such as Utah and South Carolina, are currently debating laws that would require app store operators such as Apple and Alphabet's Google to check the ages of users.
That has set up a conflict in the tech industry over which party should be responsible for checking ages for users under 18 - app stores, or each individual app.
Meta , for instance, has long argued in favor of legislation requiring app stores to check ages when a child downloads an app.
Apple on Thursday said it does not want to be responsible for collecting sensitive data for those age verifications.
"While only a fraction of apps on the App Store may require age verification, all users would have to hand over their sensitive personally identifying information to usâ€”regardless of whether they actually want to use one of these limited set of apps," Apple wrote in a whitepaper on its website.
As an alternative, Apple said it will roll out what it calls "age assurance." Using it, parents will be able to input a child's age when setting up a child's account.
The parent can then choose to allow the child to share what Apple calls a "declared age range" - rather than an exact birthday or other identifying information - with third-party app developers. The parent will have the ability to turn off age-range sharing.
"This protects privacy by keeping parents in control of their kidsâ€™ sensitive personal information, while minimizing the amount of information that is shared with third parties," Apple said in its paper.
In a statement, Stephanie Otway, a Meta spokeswoman, said the Apple technology is "a positive first step" but it still requires the child to share age range data with the developer, which will make it more difficult for Meta to put to use.
"Parents tell us they want to have the final say over the apps their teens use, and thatâ€™s why we support legislation that requires app stores to verify a childâ€™s age and get a parentâ€™s approval before their child downloads an app,â€ Otway said.
Source: Reuters Sign up for our newsletters Get our pick of top stories and thought-provoking articles in your inbox

author: Stefano DiPietro
title: Sunday's wild weather: Wintry mix to strong storms
text:
By Stefano DiPietro ,
2 hours ago NASHVILLE, Tenn. (WSMV) - FIRST ALERT WEATHER DAY - SUNDAY & MONDAY. We continue to track a large and complex storm system headed for the Midstate this weekend and are now beginning to get a clearer picture of what to expect across our area Sunday and into Monday. Precipitation is likely to start to move into the area on Sunday morning and looks like it will start with some sleet and even some light freezing rain across the Midstate. The best areas for this wintry and icy mix will be along and north of I-40 as well as higher elevations in the Cumberland Plateau. The timeline for this mix will be between 4am and noon, but could last longer in some areas in Southern Kentucky. Read full article
Read in NewsBreak 1
